intro: Catha campestris, commonly known as the African spurges or goat weed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its branched, spiny stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its adaptability, it is considered a weed in some regions and can be invasive in certain ecosystems.
